metadata.Title: CVE-2020-21490 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in GNU Binutils 2.34. It is a memory leak when process microblaze-dis.c. This one will consume memory on each insn disassembled.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-21490` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-arc-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-common - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-for-build - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-for-host - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-multiarch - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-source - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.40-2ubuntu4
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.40-2ubuntu4
libbinutils - 2.40-2ubuntu4
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.40-2ubuntu4
libctf0 - 2.40-2ubuntu4
libgprofng0 - 2.40-2ubuntu4
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> binutils isn't safe for untrusted inputs.

criterions.comment: binutils package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.40-2ubuntu4').
